channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: The Essentials, Issue #79: Checkmate
item.description: ¬† ¬† Dept. ¬† R&R ¬† Giphy If you‚Äôre in need of comfort: Replace your daily dose of doomscrolling with a glass of red wine and a puzzle in front of a homey crackling fire scene. ¬† Say cheese: In middle school, your profile pic was the be all, end all. ¬† ------ Can we start the weekend early this week? ¬† Calculate: Find out your personal carbon history. ¬†¬† Happy Place¬† ¬† Artie Photography (Artie Ng) / Getty Images Wouldn‚Äôt it be nice to just escape to Santorini, Greece, and watch the sunset while munching on a huge chunk of fresh feta? ¬† Mind over matter: When the headlines won‚Äôt stop or you find yourself flustered in Costco, try one of these three different breathing methods. ¬† Stay Sharp¬† Tidy up: I‚Äôve normalized the brown stains on all my coffee mugs, but there‚Äôs actually a way to get rid of them.
item.author: Rachel Cantor

item.title: Winners of 2020: Yeti, Papa John's
item.description: ¬† Yeti The premium outdoor brand reported revenue up 29% to $295 million and profit up a staggering 126% on increased interest in outdoor activities. It began in 2006 by targeting hunters and anglers, but has since broadened to anyone who likes their coffee warm and their iced tea chilled.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Fed Leaves Monetary Policy Unchanged Amid Election
item.description: . ¬† Reminder: The Fed handles monetary policy, manipulating the money supply to shape macroeconomic conditions like inflation and employment. ¬† Big picture: For investors, the Fed chair can be just as (if not more) important than who sits in the Oval Office. ¬†¬† This election has personal implications for Powell While the Fed's Board of Governors has two open seats that require Senate confirmation to fill, they've been empty for years, and the bigger question is who takes over as chair when Powell's term ends February 2022. Even after this election ends in 2135, Powell may not be going anywhere. Mr. Jerome Powell.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The Brew‚Äôs Weekly News Quiz: November 6
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Weed Stocks Rally on Positive Election Results, Exciting Acquisition
item.description: Aurora was sitting at a four-year low as recently as September after misjudging demand for premium products during the pandemic. ¬† Zoom out: Despite the past week‚Äôs good vibes, it‚Äôs still been a rough year for marijuana companies.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: ESPN Lays Off 300 After Taking a Pandemic Licking
item.description: ¬†¬†¬† ESPN is paying more than $7 billion for the rights to air live sports in 2020, the NYT writes. ¬† These layoffs reflect the ongoing shuffling of resources.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Brew Crossword: Let Me Tell You
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Denmark Goes to Extreme Lengths to Stamp Out New Virus Mutation
item.description: ¬† The WHO appeared to take a less aggressive tack, reiterating that mutations happen all the time in viruses and that there‚Äôs no evidence yet that this variant (which infected 12 people so far) is more dangerous to humans.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Strong Earnings and a new CEO Point to a Bright Future for CVS
item.description: The biz is also healthy CVS beat Q3 revenue expectations by about $400 million thanks to a surprisingly robust 6% rise in retail sales compared to last year. ¬† Zoom out: Lynch might be sleeping less than John King¬†when she takes over in February.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Pok√©mon Go Made A Record $1 Billion This Year
item.description: Widen the lens even further, and all-things-gaming are posting gains amid the pandemic. Newzoo estimates the industry will rake in $77.2 billion in player revenue in 2020, a 13% increase over 2019.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Saudi Arabia Lifts Restrictions on Millions of Migrant Laborers
item.description: Big picture: Saudi Arabia isn‚Äôt lifting kafala measures because it feels particularly regretful. Qatar, which is hosting the 2022 World Cup, announced similar labor reforms in August.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Gap Roundly Mocked for Cringey Election Day Unity Tweet
item.description: ¬† The online firestorm will probably discourage other brands from weighing in on the election, the NYT writes.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: U.S. Officially Leaves the Paris Agreement
item.description: Joe Biden has pledged to rejoin the Paris Agreement if he‚Äôs elected. ¬† How we got here: Leaving the agreement was a key plank in President Trump‚Äôs 2016 campaign. ¬† Big picture: In the biz world, the Paris Agreement has been an influential North Star for pollution reduction targets.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Markets, Powered by Big Tech, Shake off Uncertain Election Results
item.description: Such an outcome would have significantly boosted the chances of a coronavirus stimulus deal passing, but the prospect of more regulation and antitrust investigations under Democratic lawmakers gave Big Tech the heebie-jeebies. ¬† Stocks still went wild Many investors had speculated a ‚Äúblue wave‚Äù of Democratic candidates would sweep across America on election night.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: A Crypto-Curious Conversation
item.description: It's also important to note that many of the big financial firms are letting people invest in digital curriences in their 401(k)'s or IRA's without actually making investors personally hold the asset. This conversation with Michael and Doug certainly set a good baseline on the world of crypto investing, but we recommend continuing to research just how this asset class can work in your portfolio. As Michael and Doug discussed, this can also be achieved by investing in crypto. But it's also clear that this is one of the better times to invest in an asset like Bitcoin or other curriences‚Äîwhile the risk is there, so is the chance for major reward. ) of Crypto Investing, sponsored by Grayscale Investments. With resources like Grayscale Investments, and experts like Doug and Michael, you can make sure your financial strategy is ready for a future dominated by digital currencies. (Watch the virtual round table on-demand right here.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: Saudi Arabia Lifts Restrictions on Millions of Migrant Laborers
item.description: Yesterday, Saudi Arabia removed longstanding labor restrictions that could affect 10 million migrant workers. Qatar, which is hosting the 2022 World Cup, announced similar labor reforms in August. ¬† It‚Äôs also not the first Gulf state to ditch the kafala system.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Pok√©mon Go Made A Record $1 Billion This Year

item.description: Joe Biden has pledged to rejoin the Paris Agreement if he‚Äôs elected. ¬† How we got here: Leaving the agreement was a key plank in President Trump‚Äôs 2016 campaign. ¬† Big picture: In the biz world, the Paris Agreement has been an influential North Star for pollution reduction targets.

item.title: Markets, Powered by Big Tech, Shake off Uncertain Election Results
item.description: ¬† Stocks went wild Many investors had speculated a ‚Äúblue wave‚Äù of Democratic candidates would sweep across America on election night. While Joe Biden has a much easier path than President Trump to 270 electoral votes, Republicans are expected to retain control of the Senate, setting up potential legislative gridlock between the executive branch and Congress that makes LA rush hour seem tame.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Gap Roundly Mocked for Cringey Election Day Unity Tweet
item.description: ¬† The online firestorm will probably discourage other brands from weighing in on the election, the NYT writes.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Ant Group IPO Scrapped
item.description: Ant may still IPO, but it‚Äôll have to pull off some major reorganizing to get right with regulators. ¬† Ant Group and the government are frenemies; the Chinese Communist Party wants to cultivate the country‚Äôs capital markets... ¬† But Ant has ruffled some dangerous feathers: the Chinese government‚Äôs.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Election Results From Business-Related State Ballot Measures
item.description: ¬† Gig economy: Uber, Lyft, and DoorDash‚Äôs hugely expensive Prop 22 passed in California. ¬† The ballot measure directly challenged a recent state law that required these companies to classify their drivers as employees, not independent contractors. Or, as state election ballots called them yesterday, propositions.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Photos of Americans Voting on Election Day
item.description: The Orpheum Theater in Madison, Wisconsin ¬† Andy Manis/Getty Images The Staples Center in Los Angeles ¬† David McNew/Getty Images ¬†Bluegrass in Phoenix, AZ ¬† OLIVIER TOURON/AFP via Getty Images ¬†Watch party in New Orleans¬† ¬† EMILY KASK/AFP via Getty Images
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Majority Control U.S. Senate Still Undecided
item.description: ¬† The backstory: Republicans went into Election Day with a 53-seat Senate majority. ¬† NASA astronaut Mark Kelly pulled off a high-profile W for Dems in Arizona, flipping the state. Democrats retained their majority and may add a few seats.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: 2020 Presidential Race: A Big Fat TBD
item.description: ¬†¬† Biden swept northeastern states while Trump notched wins in typically Republican parts of the South and Midwest. ¬† ¬† At one point last night, betting markets that had long favored Biden swung to favor Trump. ¬† Looking ahead... ¬† Where things stand¬† As of this newsletter‚Äôs send time, President Trump had 213 electoral college votes and Joe Biden had 238, per the Associated Press.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: How to Get Morning Brew Swag for Free
item.description: ¬† Before we start, you can find your unique referral link at the bottom of the Brew each day. ¬† Here are 6 strategies for racking up referrals and getting free Brew swag just in time for the holidays. That‚Äôs because when you hit certain referral milestones, we‚Äôll send you Morning Brew swag, like a mug or even a sweatshirt. ¬† To a copywriter named Rob Allen, the undisputed king of Brew referrals with well over 3,000 to his name, Quora is a nonstop referral generator. ¬† 2. Do what this guy did ¬† Giphy ¬†To most people, Quora is just a popular site people visit to ask questions and find answers to every subject under the sun. But using your group chats to sign people up for the Brew can actually be a referral magnet. ¬† You can read Rob‚Äôs blog post about his referral conquest here, but the short version goes like this: he identified a commonly asked question about the stock market, answered it intelligently, added his referral link at the bottom of his answer, then watched the referrals pour in as his post earned over 180,000 page views. ¬† 6. ¬† 5. ¬† 4. ¬† 1. Let the Brew sell itself. Do what Alex and Austin did ¬† Sara Hillstrom The cofounders of the Brew know a thing or three about getting email signups. ¬† Once people have taken the bait and interacted with the screenshot (or even if they haven‚Äôt), hit them with a follow-up text saying ‚ÄúBtw, if you want to sign up for the Brew, here‚Äôs the link.‚Äù ¬† And if you get in trouble...
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Eye-Popping Numbers From the News
item.description: Here's a roundup from yesterday:¬† 1.4 billion: That's how many face masks 3M has sold so far this year, per its earnings report. Comparable sales at Popeyes grew 17.4% in Q3. Popeyes, whose iconic fried chicken sandwich is still causing traffic jams in the drive-thru lane. can you guess which one?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Texas's Economic Makeover Will Make Election Day Interesting
item.description: ¬† What it means for Election Day Data compiled by the University of Houston shows that Texas's major metropolitan areas now account for 69% of the statewide vote, up from 52% in 1968. ¬† Bottom line: It would still take a historic upswell of Democratic support to flip the state in this election.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Governments Test Shorter Quarantines to Improve Compliance
item.description: ¬† 14-day quarantines were reduced to seven days in France, while Belgium, Spain, and Germany are cutting them to 10. ¬† Canada, Thailand, and the U.S. are also considering chopping quarantines for international visitors. Which is why a handful of governments are shortening quarantines in hopes that more people will actually start complying, the WSJ reports.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: 5 and a 1/2 Steps for Fact Checking Your Social Media Feed
item.description: ¬† ¬† Disneyland2go on Twitter To make sure an account is legit, you can do a cursory scroll for red flags to see if any official websites link to it. It‚Äôs best to find the original post and fact check that instead. ¬† You can also fact check an image using techniques from Step 2 and 3: Use Google to research the photo‚Äôs background (who‚Äôs in it, what‚Äôs happening) or look it up on fact-checking sites like Snopes. ¬† The following websites are useful resources to quickly make sure a fact checks out: AP Fact Check and FactCheck are dedicated to verifying/debunking claims, while Snopes specifically tackles viral social media news. ¬† Step 2: Check your source Ask: Who posted this content? ¬† So when you feel extremely emotional about a post, rein in your urge to click, and continue your fact check. ¬† If a visualization seems suspicious for any of the above reasons, or if it‚Äôs just too crazy to be true, you can reverse image search the same way you would any other image. Is the data all from one source, or multiple? üö©: Stats, graphs, and charts that tug violently at your emotions¬† ¬† Data is Ugly on Reddit Do: Make sure any charts you‚Äôre looking at are set up in a way that isn‚Äôt misleading, like the one above. ¬† Many doctored images fit a pattern. ¬† The Media Manipulation Casebook is like its own degree in fact-checking. üö© Famous people doing things that feel out of character; any text on the image (especially on a white background); no photographer/website credited ¬† archive. ¬† Case study: You don‚Äôt need to be a pro YouTuber to create viral fake news. Even if the people behind the account are who they say they are, it‚Äôs important to check that they are who you think they are. ¬† Detecting deepfakes is so complicated that our recommendation really is just to be skeptical and check everything else you can in the post. ¬† Netflix‚Äôs The Social Dilemma is a good doc for learning more about algorithms. If Uber posts about Prop 22 (a ballot measure that directly impacts their business), it‚Äôs best to check another, independent source like a local newspaper. Step 4a: Verify the image Ask: When was this image taken? One of the best ways to debunk a fake photo like this one is to reverse image search it on Google. ¬† As we barrel roll toward the election, the news you read on social media won‚Äôt just affect your vote, but liking or sharing it could send posts spiraling into the East Australian Current that is going viral. ¬† Facebook has been taken to court for the misinformation spread like peanut butter across its platforms, while Twitter‚Äôs war on fake news has led to many dustups with POTUS‚Äîmost recently over a blocked New York Post article about Joe Biden. ¬† If the source is shady or the post takes you on that emotional roller coaster I mentioned earlier, take it with a grain of salt or go into full fact-checking mode. ¬† Go Deeper Read between the lines by learning how to spot logical fallacies.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: 15 of the Best Products on Amazon for $10 or Less
item.description: ¬† ¬† For the creative: Brainstorm new ideas with a pack of Post-Its ($10). ¬† For Earth‚Äôs greatest advocate: Shop with Ecowaare produce bags¬†as an alternative to plastic produce bags ($9). ¬† For the neat freak: Scrub away with the best sponge, Scrub Daddy ($10). ¬† For the at-home barista: Brew a successful latte with a milk frother ($9). ¬†¬† For the roommate who always forgets their keys: Hang up this keyholder magnet to ensure you never lock yourself out again ($10). ¬†¬† For the budding baker: Fall in love with this Silpat baking mat. Tip: If you shop at Amazon Smile, Amazon will donate to your favorite charitable organization. Btw, give our excellent podcast a listen here.
item.author: Rachel Cantor

item.title: Netflix's 'The Queen's Gambit' is Causing a Surge in Online Chess Play
item.description: I've always wanted to bring it to the masses," says Hikaru Nakamura, a hugely popular chess streamer on Twitch and the top-ranked blitz chess player in the world.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Major Mall Landlords File For Bankruptcy Amid Broader Retail Wipeout
item.description: ¬† During the strictest lockdown periods in the spring, Tennessee-based CBL barely collected any rent‚Äîjust 27% of what it was owed in April and a third in May. Zoom out: Malls in general are in bad shape, but CBL and PREIT in particular?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Companies Commit to Making it Easier for Workers to Vote in the Election
item.description: ¬† Zoom out: This Election Day, many employees won't have to choose between their professional and civic duties. ¬† ¬† More than 1,700 organizations have joined Time to Vote, a nonpartisan initiative spearheaded by Patagonia, Levi Strauss, and PayPal that encourages employee participation in elections.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Social Media Platforms Have Prepared for a Confusing Election Day
item.description: ¬† The run-up¬†¬† Russian interference in the 2016 election and subsequent bouts with fake news have forced social media execs to enact new policies targeting misinformation, election interference, and conspiracy theories. ¬† Advertising: Last fall, Twitter and TikTok banned all political ads. In 2020, social media platforms have become a go-to source for election information‚Äîand misinformation. Platforms have expanded their arsenals this election cycle to help voters through a confusing time. Slowing virality: Twitter added extra friction to retweets, and Facebook and Instagram are lightly pressing the brake on viral content this week. Think twice about sharing and use the Brew's guide to fact checking social media.
item.author: Alex Hickey
